section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: When the Divine Guru grants His Grace, one looks upon good and bad as the same.

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

author.author: Saint Namdev
author.description:
Saint Namdev [1270 - 1350] was born in the state of Maharashtra village of Naras-Vamani, in Satara district (presently called Narsi Namdev). His father was called Damshet, a tailor, and his mother was called Gonabai.

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. Sixty-one of his hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. He was also a close friend of Saint Trilochan.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: When the Divine Guru grants His Grace, one has good destiny written on his forehead. ||5||

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

translation.text: When the Divine Guru grants His Grace, the wall of the body is not eroded.

text: ਜਉ ਗੁਰਦੇਉ ਤ ਜਮ ਤੇ ਛੂਟੈ ॥

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Bhairao, The Word Of Ravi Daas Jee, Second House:

transliteration.text: bhairau bānī ravidās jīu kī ghar 2

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Without seeing something, the yearning for it does not arise.

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

author.author: Saint Ravidas
author.description: Saint Ravidas [1377 - 1528] was a Hindu shoemaker of the Chamar caste, who taught that a person is distinguished not by their caste, wealth or social status but instead by their actions.  Meerabai, the famous saint poetess is also said to have adopted Saint Ravidas as her Guru.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Whatever is seen, shall pass away.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: it is as if he has touched the philosopher's stone; his sense of duality is eradicated. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: pāras parasai dubidhā n hōī .1. rahāu .

translation.text: He alone is a silent sage, who destroys the duality of his mind.

text: ਮਨ ਕਾ ਸੁਭਾਉ ਸਭੁ ਕੋਈ ਕਰੈ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Everyone acts according to the inclinations of the mind.

transliteration.text: man kā subhāu sabh kōī karai .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

author.author: Saint Ravidas
author.description: Saint Ravidas [1377 - 1528] was a Hindu shoemaker of the Chamar caste, who taught that a person is distinguished not by their caste, wealth or social status but instead by their actions.  Meerabai, the famous saint poetess is also said to have adopted Saint Ravidas as her Guru.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Attuned to the Creator Lord, one remains free of fear. ||2||

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. translation.text: Plants blossom forth to produce fruit.

translation.text: When the fruit is produced, the flowers wither away.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: For the sake of spiritual wisdom, people act and practice rituals.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: When spiritual wisdom wells up, then actions are left behind. ||3||

translation.text: For the sake of ghee, wise people churn milk.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Those who are Jivan-mukta, liberated while yet alive - are forever in the state of Nirvaanaa.

translation.text: Says Ravi Daas, O you unfortunate people,

text: ਰਿਦੈ ਰਾਮੁ ਕੀ ਨ ਜਪਸਿ ਅਭਾਗ ॥੪॥੧॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: why not meditate on the Lord with love in your heart? ||4||1||

transliteration.text: ridai rām kī n japas abhāg .4.1.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Naam Dayv:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Come, O Lord of beautiful hair,

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

author.author: Saint Namdev
author.description:
Saint Namdev [1270 - 1350] was born in the state of Maharashtra village of Naras-Vamani, in Satara district (presently called Narsi Namdev). His father was called Damshet, a tailor, and his mother was called Gonabai.

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. Sixty-one of his hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. He was also a close friend of Saint Trilochan.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: wearing the robes of a Sufi Saint. ||Pause||

text: ਜਿਨਿ ਆਕਾਸ ਕੁਲਹ ਸਿਰਿ ਕੀਨੀ ਕਉਸੈ ਸਪਤ ਪਯਾਲਾ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Your cap is the realm of the Akaashic ethers; the seven nether worlds are Your sandals.

transliteration.text: jin ākās kulah sir kīnī kausai sapat payālā .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. text: ਚਮਰ ਪੋਸ ਕਾ ਮੰਦਰੁ ਤੇਰਾ ਇਹ ਬਿਧਿ ਬਨੇ ਗੁਪਾਲਾ ॥੧॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The body covered with skin is Your temple; You are so beautiful, O Lord of the World. ||1||

transliteration.text: chamar pōs kā mandar tērā ih bidh banē gupālā .1.

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. text: ਛਪਨ ਕੋਟਿ ਕਾ ਪੇਹਨੁ ਤੇਰਾ ਸੋਲਹ ਸਹਸ ਇਜਾਰਾ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The fifty-six million clouds are Your gowns, the 16,000 milkmaids are your skirts.

transliteration.text: shapan kōt kā pēhan tērā sōlah sahas ijārā .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. text: ਭਾਰ ਅਠਾਰਹ ਮੁਦਗਰੁ ਤੇਰਾ ਸਹਨਕ ਸਭ ਸੰਸਾਰਾ ॥੨॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The eighteen loads of vegetation is Your stick, and all the world is Your plate. ||2||

transliteration.text: bhār athārah mudagar tērā sahanak sabh sansārā .2.

text: ਦੇਹੀ ਮਹਜਿਦਿ ਮਨੁ ਮਉਲਾਨਾ ਸਹਜ ਨਿਵਾਜ ਗੁਜਾਰੈ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The human body is the mosque, and the mind is the priest, who peacefully leads the prayer.

transliteration.text: dēhī mahajid man maulānā sahaj nivāj gujārai .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. text: ਬੀਬੀ ਕਉਲਾ ਸਉ ਕਾਇਨੁ ਤੇਰਾ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰ ਆਕਾਰੈ ॥੩॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You are married to Maya, O Formless Lord, and so You have taken form. ||3||

transliteration.text: bībī kaulā sau kāin tērā nirankār ākārai .3.

text: ਭਗਤਿ ਕਰਤ ਮੇਰੇ ਤਾਲ ਛਿਨਾਏ ਕਿਹ ਪਹਿ ਕਰਉ ਪੁਕਾਰਾ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Performing devotional worship services to You, my cymbals were taken away; unto whom should I complain?

transliteration.text: bhagat karat mērē tāl shināē kih pah karau pukārā .

text: ਨਾਮੇ ਕਾ ਸੁਆਮੀ ਅੰਤਰਜਾਮੀ ਫਿਰੇ ਸਗਲ ਬੇਦੇਸਵਾ ॥੪॥੧॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Naam Dayv's Lord and Master, the Inner-knower, the Searcher of hearts, wanders everywhere; He has no specific home. ||4||1||

transliteration.text: nāmē kā suāmī antarajāmī phirē sagal bēdēsavā .4.1.
